title: The Mill: Haunting at Rock River
features: "A spooky, twisty book that had me sleeping with the lights on" - Amazon Review

As a psychic, Lili occasionally sees ghosts and she's thrilled to discover them lurking in the renovated paper mill where she just bought an apartment. What Lili doesn’t expect is the dark, sinister presence under the floor or the serial killer who's prowling the hallways.When a woman is found murdered and another goes missing, Lili works with one of the spirits—a young girl long dead—to expose the psychopath. But not everyone can be trusted, the chase goes awry, and the killer flees. Can he be captured, or will he remain free to strike again?From the bestselling author of

The Mill will attract readers who like thrillers that include supernatural elements. They include human and ghostly threats, from a serial killer who prowls the place and is involved in a series of escalating murders to spirits who seek revenge and resolution in order to move on. Cailyn Lloyd creates a powerful juxtaposition of murder mystery and police procedural. Changing realities, relationships, and revelations makes The Mill a fresh genre read that mystery enthusiasts will relish -
D. Donovan, Sr. Reviewer, Midwest Book Review
The Mill is filled with razor-sharp characters and a deliciously dark plot - another fantastic example of Cailyn Lloyd's masterful storytelling! -
Steve Stred, author of Mastodon and Incarnate

The Mill is a fun genre blend of supernatural, thriller and suspense. Cailyn Lloyd has created a whole world of possibilities in a single setting, complete with ghosts, psychics, killers, and SWAT teams. A unique take on the supernatural thriller -

The Mill is fast-paced and reads like a paranormal crime thriller. Each scene has its own self-contained arc while also pushing the plot forward. Switching between multiple perspectives throughout the novel also builds tension and urgency up to the conclusion. Lloyd does an excellent job of differentiating the motivations and perspectives of her characters. With Chase, she's particularly successful. It's upsetting to read the sections from Chase's perspective precisely because Lloyd forces the reader to inhabit his mind so successfully. He's an arrogant, cold-blooded killer who believes in his own infallibility -
Dreadfulesque Reviews
Whoa! What a ride. It was very fast paced. I recommend giving this one a chance! -
Tiffany Guthrie

The Mill is a riveting novel, filled with suspense, and the pacing makes me read word after word, page after page, chapter after chapter, never wanting to stop. The original concept for the ghosts had me smiling and cringing and I never would have guessed how it would be wrapped up -
Sherry Fundin, Fundimental Reviews
